title: How many shots can a disposable camera take? - Quora

response.answer_text: It doesn’t matter. If you dispose of the camera, you will never see them. A one-time-use camera (which is sent to the lab for processing and recycling of parts) usually allows 27 images. They use the same pieces of film normally sold as 24 exposure rolls. Since they are loaded in the dark then don’t fog the initial part of the film.
Typically 27 frames, but to be sure, look for a “large number” on the body or box of the product. They typically make it very obvious.
